bib_record.title: Determination of the total neutron cross section for natural hafnium on the filtered neutron beam with 2 keV energy

free_txt: Data for 2 keV filter is the same as in the first ref.
Data for 54, 59 and 145 keV included in 32250.
Reactor WWR-M
Dead time correction, background correction
. Correction on a
self-shielding effect (calculated by simulating an
experiment using the MCNP4C code based on ENDF/B-VI and
CENDL-3.1).
The He-3 counter CHM-17 (diameter - 18 mm,
length - 500 mm, gas pressure - 7 atm).
Errors include statistical error of
the transmission measurements; meausurement errors of
dimension and weight of the sample.
The evaluated error values to the cross section
connected with the presence of additional lines at
the 26.7 keV energy is 0.035%, at 42.8 keV, 49.0 keV
and 64.6 keV lines are 0.145%, 0.017% and 0.125%,
respectively. So, the error to the cross section
connected with the presence of all additional lines
did not exceed 0.322%.
Reactor WWR-M
Neutron filters installed in horizontal channel
of the reactor.
Filter 2 keV.  Average energy of filtered neutron
(1.91 (+0.69,-0.86))keV (95% response function),
the filter components (g/cm2):   Sc-110.59, Ni60-80.2,
Purity of the filter - 99.6 %. Other additions to the
main neutron line were about: a line with the energy
Hafnium metal (the chemical composition of the metal
was: hafnium is not less than 99.26%, the mass
fraction of impurities - 0.74%, of which 0.62%
belongs to zirconium). A set of samples was made with
a diameter of 30.4 mm. In each series of measurements
was used set of metal hafnium samples with
thicknesses (in nuclei/b):
The mean value of the experimental unshielded total
cross section obtained from results with six hafnium
measurements using the resonance self-shielding factors
calculated with the CENDL-3.1 library.
Errors include statistical error of
the transmission measurements; measurement errors of
dimension and weight of the sample.
The evaluated error values to the cross section
connected with the presence of additional lines at
the 26.7 keV energy is 0.035%, at 42.8 keV, 49.0 keV
and 64.6 keV lines are 0.145%, 0.017% and 0.125%,
respectively. So, the error to the cross section
connected with the presence of all additional lines
did not exceed 0.322%.
The mean value of the experimental unshielded
total cross section obtained from results with six
hafnium measurements using the resonance self-shielding
factors calculated with the ENDF/B-VI library.
Text on p.292 in Yad.Fiz. ta Energ.,18,287,2017
Calculated neutron spectrum after
filter 2 keV
Correspond to Fig.2
in Yad. Fiz. ta Energ.,18,287,2017.
